intro: Hysterionica dianthifolia, commonly known as the fairy dianthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in early summer and are often used in rock gardens due to their ornamental value. Hysterionica dianthifolia is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its resilience to harsh weather conditions.
